result.execSummary:
The defendant Greyson Kenneth Balow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/costs to be paid in installments of $100.00 per month commencing 07-01-2017 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full.  Failure to pay will result in 1 day jail for every $50.00 unpaid.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Greyson Kenneth Balow

records.addlTxt: Balance owing on payment plan paid in full.
Time to Pay Summary

Defendant Greyson Kenneth Balow in court with attorney Michael R. Cohen.  John Harrison Sacia appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution reached, defendant will plead to count #2, joint recommendation $200 + costs.  Court advises defendant of charge in amended information/max penalties and rights.  Defendant enters plea of guilty.  Court finds defendants waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently and done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.  Assess fine $200 + costs.  TTP of $100/mo. com. 7/1/17.  FTP = 1 day jail for every $50 unpaid.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2017 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Possession of THC - 2nd and subsequent offense.

Defendant Greyson Kenneth Balow in court with attorney Michael R. Cohen.  Taavi McMahon Special Prosecutor for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.  Defendant waives right to PH, State moves to amend Information to possession 2nd offense, joint recommendation fine/costs $200.00.  Off record.  On record.  Informal discussion regarding pros and cons of proposal at hand.  Atty Miller requests Hon. recuse himself.  Counsel wishes to proceed with WOPH, files WOPH form with the court.  Court shows WOPH, binds defendant over for trial.  Special Pros. files Information with the court.  Court instructs counsel to take up scheduling Arraignment with new judge assigned.
Preliminary hearing on April 10, 2017 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 14, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Greyson Kenneth Balow in court with attorney Michael R. Cohen.  John Sacia appeared by phone means for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel informs close to getting matter resolved.  Set for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on December 20, 2016 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on October 4, 2016 at 11:00 am.
No possession or consumption of any restricted controlled substance.

Defendant Greyson Kenneth Balow in court with attorney Michael R. Cohen.  Taavi Mc Mahon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advised defendant of charges/max. penalties, constitutional rights and right to Preliminary Hearing within 10 days if in custody, 20 days if not.  State requests $1000 Sign. Bond with condition:  Not possess or consume any convicted controlled substance.  Defendant waives time limits for P.H.  Referred to scheduling clerk for Cont'd INIT.
Initial appearance on July 18, 2016 at 08:45 am.
Atty Taavi McMahon or Designee appointed
